title: Richard Madeley refuses Strictly after awkward twerking on The Circle
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Don’t expect to catch Richard Madeley on Strictly Come Dancing next series as his awkward twerking on The Circle has left him too embarrassed to compete on the show.

The This Morning host entertained us all on the Channel 4 catfishing show when he donned a motion capture suit and showed off his best dance moves, including an epic twerk, a terrible robot and a bizarre dab, in a bid to win treats for his co-stars.

It was frankly too much for us to handle and Richard is adamant there won’t be a repeat performance or a stint on BBC One’s Strictly.

Speaking on Good Morning Britain, Richard said: ‘That was my worst moment because I obviously cannot dance which is why I would never do Strictly.’

Spoil sport.

He then jokingly took a jibe at the first celebrity to be booted off this year’s Strictly: ‘I’d be worse than James Cracknell.’

Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid tried to coax Richard into doing a quick twerk live on-air but he refused to play ball, stating: ‘I’m not standing up and twerking up my arse.’

Richard Madeley twerking on The Circle (Picture: Channel 4)

Richard won’t be applying for Strictly anytime soon (Picture: Good Morning Britain, ITV)

That would’ve been a picture.

Reflecting on his stint on The Circle, Richard said: ‘It taught me that social media can be absolutely real.

‘It’s impossible if people play the game well, and I mean the game in the broader sense of social media, it’s impossible to tell who’s telling the truth.’

He also said of his friendship with Georgina: ‘I realised when I saw the photo of her in the swimsuit, it didn’t hit me at first and I asked her to see it again, and I thought, “Oh my God, she’s wearing a bowel bag”, and she’s doing it to make a statement to say look, it’s cool.

‘I was full of admiration for her and we got on right away.’
